Special Characters

Special character also called metacharacters are a group of characters that have special meanings in the bash language.
We already see â€œ

>" that redirect the output of a command in a file.\\

  • a string with o or more character <code bash> ls /dev/tty* </code> ? a single character <code bash> ls /dev/tty? </code> [ ] one of a single character listed <code bash> ls /dev/tty[2-4] </code> {} one of a single string listed <code bash> ls /dev/tty{zd,zc} </code>
